newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand to float 30 bln yen samurai bonds.
newsitem.headline: Thailand to float 30 bln yen samurai bonds.

text.p: The Thai government plans to float two samurai bonds worth a total of 30 billion yen during November 15-December 15 to raise funds for Thai Airways International Plc to buy new planes, finance ministry officials said on Thursday.
They said the planned five and 10-year bonds would raise funds for the national carrier to acquire two new aircraft worth about $350 million.
The cost of the aircraft will be partly financed by Thai Airways' cash resources.

The officials said the finance ministry will this week invite bids from five major Japanese securities firms for underwriting mandates for the two issues and its choices are expected to be made next week.
The five prospective underwriters are Yamaichi Securities Co Ltd, Daiwa Securities Co Ltd, Nomura Securities Co Ltd, Nikko Securities Co Ltd, and IBJ Securities Co Ltd.
They said the ministry will swap yen-denominated funds raised by the issues into fixed-rate dollars after the issues are floated.
